description: Shrubby evening primrose (Calylophus serrulatus) is an amazing species of plant that blooms in the evening. Its stunning yellow daisy-like flowers will appear each night and stay open until the heat of the following day. It will often self-sow and provide visual interest to the landscape year-round. Additionally, its low-maintenance and drought-tolerant nature makes it perfect for novice gardeners and water-wise gardens. It's certainly a sight to behold and can be an eye-catching attraction for any garden!
